required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pramipexole Pilot Phase II Study in Children and Adolescents With Tourette Disorder According to DSM-IV Criteria
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Flexible Dose Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Pramipexole Immediate Release (0.125-0.5mg/Day) Versus Placebo for 6 Weeks in Children and Adolescents (Age 6-17 Inclusive) Diagnosed With Tourette Disorder According to DSM IV Criteria.

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, flexible dose study to evaluate efficacy and safety of Pramipexole versus placebo for 6 weeks in children (age 6-17) diagnosed with Tourette Disorder according to DSM IV criteria. The primary efficacy measure will be the Total Tic Score (TTS) of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale (YGTSS) at 6 weeks.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Tic Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale
primary_outcome.description: Total Tic Score is the sum of ten individual ratings of the impairment due to tics. Each scale ranges from 0 (None/Absent) to 5 (Severe) and total score ranges from 0 to 50. Analysis was adjusted for baseline total tic score and age as linear covariates.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Tic Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale at Week 1
secondary_outcome.description: Total Tic Score is the sum of ten individual ratings of the impairment due to tics. Each scale ranges from 0 (None/Absent) to 5 (Severe) and total score ranges from 0 to 50

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Tic Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale at Week 2
secondary_outcome.description: Total Tic Score is the sum of ten individual ratings of the impairment due to tics. Each scale ranges from 0 (None/Absent) to 5 (Severe) and total score ranges from 0 to 50

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Tic Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale at Week 3
secondary_outcome.description: Total Tic Score is the sum of ten individual ratings of the impairment due to tics. Each scale ranges from 0 (None/Absent) to 5 (Severe) and total score ranges from 0 to 50

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Tic Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Total Tic Score is the sum of ten individual ratings of the impairment due to tics. Each scale ranges from 0 (None/Absent) to 5 (Severe) and total score ranges from 0 to 50

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale Due to Motor and Phonic Tics at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Total Score is a rating of the overall impairment due to motor and phonic tics. The scale ranges from 0 (None) to 50 (Severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale Due to Motor and Phonic Tics at Week 1
secondary_outcome.description: Total Score is a rating of the overall impairment due to motor and phonic tics. The scale ranges from 0 (None) to 50 (Severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale Due to Motor and Phonic Tics at Week 2
secondary_outcome.description: Total Score is a rating of the overall impairment due to motor and phonic tics. The scale ranges from 0 (None) to 50 (Severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale Due to Motor and Phonic Tics at Week 3
secondary_outcome.description: Total Score is a rating of the overall impairment due to motor and phonic tics. The scale ranges from 0 (None) to 50 (Severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale Due to Motor and Phonic Tics at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Total Score is a rating of the overall impairment due to motor and phonic tics. The scale ranges from 0 (None) to 50 (Severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Improvement at 1 Week
secondary_outcome.description: Overall improvement during the last week compared to baseline ranging from 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), to 7 (very much worse). Responder has 'very much' or 'much' improvement. Non responder has less improvement than 'much' improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Improvement at Week 2
secondary_outcome.description: Overall improvement during the last week compared to baseline ranging from 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), to 7 (very much worse). Responder has 'very much' or 'much' improvement. Non responder has less improvement than 'much' improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Improvement at Week 3
secondary_outcome.description: Overall improvement during the last week compared to baseline ranging from 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), to 7 (very much worse). Responder has 'very much' or 'much' improvement. Non responder has less improvement than 'much' improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Improvement at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Overall improvement during the last week compared to baseline ranging from 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), to 7 (very much worse). Responder has 'very much' or 'much' improvement. Non responder has less improvement than 'much' improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Improvement at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Overall improvement during the last week compared to baseline ranging from 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), to 7 (very much worse). Responder has 'very much' or 'much' improvement. Non responder has less improvement than 'much' improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Severity of Illness at Week 1
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the overall severity of illness on a scale ranging from 1 (not at all ill) to 7 (the most extremely ill patients). Improved, Unchanged and Worsened responses correspond to changes from baseline of: -2 or less, -1 to +1, and 2 or greater.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Severity of Illness at Week 2
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the overall severity of illness on a scale ranging from 1 (not at all ill) to 7 (the most extremely ill patients). Improved, Unchanged and Worsened responses correspond to changes from baseline of: -2 or less, -1 to +1, and 2 or greater.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Severity of Illness at Week 3
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the overall severity of illness on a scale ranging from 1 (not at all ill) to 7 (the most extremely ill patients). Improved, Unchanged and Worsened responses correspond to changes from baseline of: -2 or less, -1 to +1, and 2 or greater.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Severity of Illness at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the overall severity of illness on a scale ranging from 1 (not at all ill) to 7 (the most extremely ill patients). Improved, Unchanged and Worsened responses correspond to changes from baseline of: -2 or less, -1 to +1, and 2 or greater.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Severity of Illness at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the overall severity of illness on a scale ranging from 1 (not at all ill) to 7 (the most extremely ill patients). Improved, Unchanged and Worsened responses correspond to changes from baseline of: -2 or less, -1 to +1, and 2 or greater.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression at Week 1
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the change of the patient's overall condition during the last week compared to the patient's condition at baseline on a scale ranging from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse). A responder is defined as having a response of very much (1) or much better (2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression at Week 2
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the change of the patient's overall condition during the last week compared to the patient's condition at baseline on a scale ranging from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse). A responder is defined as having a response of very much (1) or much better (2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression at Week 3
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the change of the patient's overall condition during the last week compared to the patient's condition at baseline on a scale ranging from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse). A responder is defined as having a response of very much (1) or much better (2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the change of the patient's overall condition during the last week compared to the patient's condition at baseline on a scale ranging from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse). A responder is defined as having a response of very much (1) or much better (2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the change of the patient's overall condition during the last week compared to the patient's condition at baseline on a scale ranging from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse). A responder is defined as having a response of very much (1) or much better (2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically Significant Abnormalities in Vital Signs (Orthostatic Reaction and Pulse Rate), and Serum Chemistry.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male of female patients 6-17 yrs.
- Written informed consent.
- Diagnosed with Tourette's Disorder with a > or equal to 22 on the Total Tic Score at baseline.
- Diagnosed with Tourette's Disorder when administering the Diagnostic Interview Schedule for Children.
- Having at least 1 tic/day.
- Women of childbearing age must have a negative serum pregnancy test at screening and must use a medically accepted contraceptive method.
- Either a newly diagnosed patient or a patient diagnosed with Tourette's Disorder who can safely discontinue treatment.
- Having a body weight of > or equal to 20 kg (44 lbs).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any women of childbearing age having a positive serum pregnancy test at screening.
- Patients who have clinically significant renal disease or serum creatinine greater than 1.0 mg/dL at screening.
- Lab results at screening: hemoglobin below lower limit of normal which is determined to be clinically significant; Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH), triiodothyronine (T3) or thyroxine (T4) clinically significant; clinically significant abnormalities in labs.
- Other clinically significant metabolic-endocrine, hematological, gastrointestinal disease, pulmonary disease which would preclude the patient from participating in this study.
- History of Schizophrenia or any psychotic disorder, history of mental disorders or any present Axis I psychiatric disorder according to Diagnostic and Statistic Manual of Mental Disorders Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) requiring any medical therapy except for patients with a diagnosis of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) or obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) who are not on therapy.
- History of/or clinical signs of epilepsy or seizures other than fever related seizures in early childhood.
- History of/or clinical signs of any malignant neoplasm.
- Allergic response to pramipexole.
- Had previous treatment with dopamine agonists other than pramipexole within 14 days prior to baseline visit.
- Had any other medical treatment for Tourette's Disorder besides the study medication within 28 days prior to baseline visit.
- Had withdrawal symptoms of any medication at screening or at the baseline visit.
- Having a Kaufman Brief Intelligence Test (KBIT IQ) score <70 at screening.
- Having a children's Yale-Brown obsessive-compulsive scale (CY-BOCS) score of >15 at baseline.
- Patients who meet criteria for Restless Legs Syndrome and or Periodic Limb Movement disorder.
- Patients with severe asthma.
- Patients that have initiated psychotherapy for Tourette's Disorder, OCD or ADHD within 3 mths of starting the trial.
- Patients receiving psychological, cognitive and/or behavioral treatments greater than 3 mths prior to start of trial for Tourette's Disorder, OCD, and/or ADHD who will have changes in treatment plan.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablets matching the Pramipexole tablets to be taken per os

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: Pramipexole (tablets of 0.0625 mg, 0.125 mg and 0.25 mg) to be taken per os. Starting dose 0.0625 mg bid, with possible down titration after one week to 0.0625 mg qd or optional up titration to 0.125 mg bid, after the second week optional up titration to 0.125 mg tid, after the third week optional up titration to 0.25 mg bid.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablets matching the Pramipexole tablets to be taken per os

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: Pramipexole (tablets of 0.0625 mg, 0.125 mg and 0.25 mg) to be taken per os. Starting dose 0.0625 mg bid, with possible down titration after one week to 0.0625 mg qd or optional up titration to 0.125 mg bid, after the second week optional up titration to 0.125 mg tid, after the third week optional up titration to 0.25 mg bid.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Attention Deficit Hyperactive Disorder
measure.description: Diagnosis of disorder was performed using National Institute of Mental Health Diagnostic Interview Schedule for Children (NIMH DISC IV) and resulted in patients being classified as negative diagnosis, intermediate diagnosis and positive diagnosis for disorder.

measure.title: Duration of Tourettes syndrome
Ethnicity, Customized
Obsessive Compulsive Disorder
measure.description: Diagnosis of disorder was performed using National Institute of Mental Health Diagnostic Interview Schedule for Children (NIMH DISC IV) and resulted in patients being classified as negative, intermediate and positive for disorder.

measure.title: Race, Customized
Body Mass Index
Height
Weight

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Tic Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale
outcome.description: Total Tic Score is the sum of ten individual ratings of the impairment due to tics. Each scale ranges from 0 (None/Absent) to 5 (Severe) and total score ranges from 0 to 50. Analysis was adjusted for baseline total tic score and age as linear covariates.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) with last observation carried forward (LOCF).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablets matching the Pramipexole tablets to be taken per os

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: Pramipexole (tablets of 0.0625 mg, 0.125 mg and 0.25 mg) to be taken per os. Starting dose 0.0625 mg bid, with possible down titration after one week to 0.0625 mg qd or optional up titration to 0.125 mg bid, after the second week optional up titration to 0.125 mg tid, after the third week optional up titration to 0.25 mg bid.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Tic Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale
measure.description: Total Tic Score is the sum of ten individual ratings of the impairment due to tics. Each scale ranges from 0 (None/Absent) to 5 (Severe) and total score ranges from 0 to 50. Analysis was adjusted for baseline total tic score and age as linear covariates.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) with last observation carried forward (LOCF).

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Tic Score of the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale at Week 1
outcome.description: Total Tic Score is the sum of ten individual ratings of the impairment due to tics. Each scale ranges from 0 (None/Absent) to 5 (Severe) and total score ranges from 0 to 50
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set was composed of patients that provided a baseline and a post-baseline assessment in Total Tic Score. A total of 62 patients are included in the Full Analysis Set, 20 placebo patients and 42 pramipexole patients.

measure.population: The Full Analysis Set with last observation carried forward (LOCF).

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impressions - Improvement at Week 3
outcome.description: Overall improvement during the last week compared to baseline ranging from 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), to 7 (very much worse). Responder has 'very much' or 'much' improvement. Non responder has less improvement than 'much' improvement.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set with last observation carried forward (LOCF).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablets matching the Pramipexole tablets to be taken per os

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: Pramipexole (tablets of 0.0625 mg, 0.125 mg and 0.25 mg) to be taken per os. Starting dose 0.0625 mg bid, with possible down titration after one week to 0.0625 mg qd or optional up titration to 0.125 mg bid, after the second week optional up titration to 0.125 mg tid, after the third week optional up titration to 0.25 mg bid.

measure.population: The Full Analysis Set with last observation carried forward (LOCF).

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impressions - Severity of Illness at Week 1
outcome.description: Assessment of the overall severity of illness on a scale ranging from 1 (not at all ill) to 7 (the most extremely ill patients). Improved, Unchanged and Worsened responses correspond to changes from baseline of: -2 or less, -1 to +1, and 2 or greater.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set with last observation carried forward (LOCF).

outcome.title: Patient Global Impression at Week 1
outcome.description: Assessment of the change of the patient's overall condition during the last week compared to the patient's condition at baseline on a scale ranging from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse). A responder is defined as having a response of very much (1) or much better (2).
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set with last observation carried forward (LOCF).

group.description: Placebo tablets matching the Pramipexole tablets to be taken per os

reported_events.time_frame: All events with an onset after the first dose of study medication and up to a period of 48 hours after the last dose of study medication were assigned to the treatment period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablets matching the Pramipexole tablets to be taken per os

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
